meanings.definition: A separate printing of an article or chapter that originally appeared as part of a larger publication.
meanings.sent1: I ordered some offprints of the research paper to share with my colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The professor provided offprints of the study for the students to review.
meanings.sent3: The offprints of the article were so tiny, they looked like mini books!
meanings.sent4: Her offprints of the chapter were like little treasures hidden in the book.
meanings.sent5: The offprints of the report were scattered across the desk, waiting to be read.

meanings.definition: To print or publish separately from the main body of work.
meanings.sent1: She decided to offprints the new findings before including them in the final report.
meanings.sent2: The author offprints the introduction to give readers a sneak peek.
meanings.sent3: He offprints the poem on a bright pink paper to make it stand out.
meanings.sent4: The company offprints the promotional material to distribute at the event.
meanings.sent5: They offprints the bonus chapter as a special gift for loyal readers.
